description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Abu Dhabi" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Abu Dhabi

places.generalDescription: Al Hudayriyat Beach, nestled on the picturesque Hudayriyat Island just a short 10-minute drive from Abu Dhabi's bustling city center, is a true gem for beach lovers and families alike. This expansive stretch of golden sand boasts crystal-clear waters that are perfect for sunbathing or taking a refreshing dip. The beach is not only popular among locals but also attracts tourists seeking an escape from the urban hustle and bustle.

sources.snippet: Al Hudayriat Beach is well known as one of the  Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi situated on Hudayriat Island. This beach is famous for its vast area of sand and equally clean and warm water that can be perfect for both sunbathing and swimming. And it is quite popular among people, both inhabitants of the city and tourists, who want to free their souls from the noisy and tense life of a metropolis.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Public Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Hudayriyat Beach, from Modon Properties, offers stunning views and diverse dining options with food trucks. Enjoy a serene retreat just 10 minutes from Abu Dhabi's city center. Timing: Monday to Sunday- 7:00 am to 6:00 pm
sources.shortName: Discover Abudhabi's Public Beaches
Abu Dhabi Beaches - 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Al Hudayriyat Beach

reviews.text:
Nice, relaxing spot to enjoy the sea without spending anything.

üåø Reminder: Please don't litter-bring your garbage with you or throw it in the trash bins provided. Let's keep the beach clean for everyone!

‚úÖ Public beach (no entrance fee)

üçΩÔ∏è You can bring food and set up small tables

üèïÔ∏è Camping chairs and tents allowed (daytime only)

üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Swimming is only until sunset.

üö´ No overnight stays

üö´ Grilling not allowed

üö´ Bonfires not allowed

Had an amazing time staying in the duplex tent villas, decided to check out early, and enjoy a fun day on the beach before heading home. Unfortunately, this spoiled our stay when our teenage boys were not allowed to play with a small ball on the beach or in the water (There wrre only 2 other people in the water miles away & 20 people on the beach miles away). If you're looking at spending a fun family beach day, this is not the place for you. Taking it a bit too far spoiling an amazing staycation.

spot for relaxation and outdoor activities. The clean sands, clear waters, and well-maintained facilities make it a great destination for families and friends. The cycling and jogging tracks add an extra layer of fun for those looking to stay active. However, it would be even better if there were more beach chairs available, as seating can sometimes be limited. Overall, it's a wonderful place to unwind and enjoy the beautiful Abu Dhabi coastline

places.address: New Beach Near Al Bateen Beach, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Corniche Beach in Abu Dhabi is a popular city beach with international clean-water status. The main beachfront stretches for eight kilometers, offering white sand, turquoise water, and a beautifully landscaped boulevard. Divided into several sections with lifeguarded beaches, it caters to families and action-seekers alike. The chic promenade features food stalls, cafes, and sitting-out areas that create a tropical paradise ambiance.

sources.snippet: This is Abu Dhabi‚Äôs main public beach and is where the majority of travellers will head down to at some point The Corniche beach is also one of the most popular with locals and dominates a large part of the citys waterfront, arcing around the pleasant corniche close to the Emirates Palace and Marina Mall. The Corniche beach is seperated into three areas with three seperate entrances. The middle area is free public access where anyone can go on and just enjoy themselves, the beach is spotlessly clean and can get busy on the weekends with people sunbathing, playing volleyball or just enjoying some watersports.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Abu Dhabi Beach Guide.

sources.snippet: Corniche Beach is one of the most popular and well-maintained public beaches in Abu Dhabi located along the Corniche Road. This well-maintained beach is divided into three sections to cater to different groups: For the single and group visitors, Al Sahil beach; the principal beach for families and those in search of solitude; and a family and children‚Äôs beach. The beach has got Blue Flag status which implies that it is clean and safe; it has got life guards, sun beds, umbrellas, showers and changing rooms.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Public Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Crowning Abu Dhabi‚Äôs main seafront in an 8km stretch of golden sand, Corniche beach is where all the action happens. Backdropped by a swathe of glass and steel skyscrapers, the spotless beach is a fabulous place to unfurl you towel, admire the skyline and people watch. Volleyball courts and football pitches make it ideal for activity-thirsty beachgoers, while cycle paths and pedestrian pathways are perfect routes for exploring the expanse of Corniche beach.
sources.shortName: Abu Dhabis best beaches | Jumeirah

sources.snippet: Probably the one beach that everyone knows about before they have the pleasure of setting foot in Abu Dhabi is the Corniche. Stretching over 2km, the beach is divided into three sections; Al Sahil (Gate 4) for singles and large adult groups; Gate 2 and 3 are for families with the other two gates fenced off from public viewing. Kick back and soak up some rays on sun loungers and cabanas or go old school with a towel on the sand.
sources.shortName: 10 best public beaches in Abu Dhabi 2024

sources.snippet: As a Blue Flag-certified public beach, Corniche Beach boasts a seaside boardwalk, gardens, walking and cycling pathways, a kid's play area, and several restaurants and cafes. The 2km beach is divided into three sections: Al Sahil (Gate 4, free entry) is perfect for singles and larger groups, while Gate 2 (which has a quiet zone) and Gate 3 are great for families. You can find showers, changing rooms and cabanas.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: The Corniche Public Beach has a total lengths of 1km and invites you to take a leisurely stroll or for a bit of jogging along the water It stretches along the city parallell to the famous Abu Dhabi corniche road. Here you will not only be able to enjoy the beautiful white sandy beach but you will have the impressive backdrop of the Abu Dhabi skyline right behind you. Perfect for the selfie fanatics out there...
sources.shortName: Beach in Abu Dhabi - The best Beaches across Abu Dhabi City

sources.snippet: Having opened in 2008, Abu Dhabi Corniche is one of the city‚Äôs old guards. It is Blue Flag-certified, popular with families and fringed by eight kilometres of boardwalk and manicured gardens that run through the heart of the city. The sand itself is split into two sections ‚Äì one is free and one is primarily for families and female visitors, with a small entry fee for adults and children over five.
sources.shortName: The 8 best beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: There are all kinds of beaches in Abu Dhabi, each with its public: the most well known are those of The corniche - the most beautiful are on Saadiyat Island - the smallest on Yas Island, along the mangrove - the most confidential at the the Emirates Palace. The more offbeat on Maya Island. This article will help you to find the beach that suits you and will give you some practical advice.
sources.shortName: TOP 5 best beach in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: The most easily accessible beach in Abu Dhabi is the Corniche Public Beach which runs parallel to the famous Corniche Road. This long sandy beach is flanked by verdant gardens set against the backdrop of Abu Dhabi‚Äôs impressive skyline. The beach is protected by an artificial breakwater making it particularly suitable for families with smaller children, as there are no strong currents.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi in 2024

sources.snippet: Corniche Beach, crowning Abu Dhabi‚Äôs main seafront, stretches over 8km of golden sand. This spotlessly maintained Blue Flag public beach is a gem in the heart of the UAE capital. The beach is divided into three sections: Al Sahil (Gate 4, free entry) is perfect for singles and groups, while the other sections cater to families and those seeking a quieter experience.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: It is located along Corniche Road and is known for its beautiful views of the Abu Dhabi skyline. The beach boasts a range of facilities, including showers, changing rooms, and various water sports activities. Corniche Beach is also home to many food and beverage outlets, making it an ideal place to enjoy a meal while enjoying the beautiful views.
sources.shortName: Guide To Abu Dhabi Beaches: Locations, Photos, And Ratings.

sources.snippet: Abu Dhabi‚Äôs Corniche Beach, which opened in 2008, is one of the most popular beaches and tourist destinations in the city. The 8 kilometres long beach extends along the Corniche Road, from near Hilton Hotel to Al Khaleej Al Arabi Street. Other interesting attractions, such as the Marina Mall and the Presidential Palace are located nearby.
sources.shortName: 10 Beaches in Abu Dhabi for a Perfect Beachside Vacation 2024

sources.snippet: The main promenade that runs between the city center and the Arabian Gulf Sea, The Corniche Beach is the place to be if you enjoy people watching, cycling, and a great view of the city‚Äôs skyline. This is a public beach, which means no entry fee, plus the Blue Flag Status means it‚Äôs safe for swimming!. Address: Corniche Road, Abu Dhabi
sources.shortName: The Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Abu Dhabi's Corniche Beach offers pristine sands and turquoise waters, perfect for relaxation and outdoor fun. Divided into sections for families, solo travelers, and groups, it features cycling trails, volleyball courts, and football pitches. Enjoy water activities like speedboating and snorkeling, then unwind at beachfront eateries.
sources.shortName: Discover Abudhabi's Public Beaches

sources.snippet: This beach was opened in the year 2008 and continues to be among the famous tourist attractions in Abu Dhabi. It is an 8-kilometer-long beach that starts from the Hilton hotel to Al Khaleej Al Arabi Street and moves along Corniche Road. Marina Mall and the Presidential Palace are the other interesting attractions nearby.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Beaches in Abu Dhabi for a Peaceful Getaway

sources.snippet: The most prominent beach among them all is Corniche Beach, right in the centre of the city which stretches for 2 kilometres along the city‚Äôs waterfront. This endless stretch of ivory sand in front of the city‚Äôs remarkable skyline is divided into three sections. One section is for singles and groups and is free of charge.
sources.shortName: Explore the Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi on Your Next Holiday

sources.snippet: Let‚Äôs start with one of the most popular public beaches in Abu Dhabi ‚Äì the Corniche. This beach stretches from the nearby  Hilton Hotel on the Corniche Road all the way to the Al Khaleej Al Arabi Street and beyond. For years, it‚Äôs been impeccably maintained, and it‚Äôs got the famous beach Blue Flag eco-label to prove it!
sources.siteName: A blog about homes, trends, tips & life in the UAE | MyBayut
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi - Public Beaches, Beach Clubs & More

sources.snippet: This beach which opened up in 2008, continues to be among the popular tourist attractions in Abu Dhabi. It is an 8-kilometer-long beach that starts from the Hilton hotel to Al Khaleej Al Aarabi street and runs along the Corniche road. Marina Mall and the Presidential Palace are the other most interesting attractions.
sources.shortName: Top 12 Beaches In Abu Dhabi To Wash Away Your Troubles Of Everyday Life

sources.snippet: Comprising a spacious promenade, a small plaza and plenty of beach space, this beach is made with everyone in mind. Corniche beach is free to use, and ideal if you want to dip into the Persian Gulf. there are lifeguards to ensure everyone‚Äôs safety, and for added comfort, the beach has been divided into 3 zones.
sources.shortName: 10 paradise beaches in Abu Dhabi you need to visit!

sources.snippet: A long-time favourite among residents and tourists alike, Corniche Beach is divided into three sections: Al Sahil (Gate 4) for singles and groups, Gate 2 for families (with a quiet zone), and Gate 3 for families and children. The gleaming white sand and clear waters make it perfect for a day of relaxation.
sources.shortName: Choosing the Best Beach in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Divided into sections, Corniche Beach offers a blend of relaxation and recreational activities. Families can enjoy the children‚Äôs play area or explore the cycling and pedestrian pathways. You can also dive into the turquoise waters for snorkelling or simply unwind on a sun lounger.
sources.shortName: Life's a beach: 11 of the best public beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Abu Dhabi is well-known for its pristine Corniche Beach, a landmark that defines the entire city. Residents and visitors alike tend to head over there for a perfect day in the sun. It‚Äôs not exactly a hidden gem, but it‚Äôs definitely a gem nonetheless!
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: You‚Äôve probably driven past it lots of times but have you ever spent a day on the beach on the Corniche?. It‚Äôs one of the best beaches in Abu Dhabi for a quick trip. The pristine beachfront is a fantastic family spot on which to enjoy a relaxed day.
sources.shortName: The 6 best beaches in Abu Dhabi
Abu Dhabi Beaches - 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Corniche Beach

reviews.text:
The Abu Dhabi corniche beach is so beautiful. The stunning scenery of the tall skyscrapers. The sand is clean to walk barefoot. Lifeguards are on duty for your safety. Cycling track and a playground for children. Small kiosk for snacks.
Paid parking is located opposite the corniche.

Liked this beach very much! We visited in the April, 2025. There is a fee for the entrance and sunbeds are also paid and in the short supply, so it possible, that they will be unavailable.
Nice place for the relaxation, fair enough price.
You could spent there whole day, have drinks and foods.
Sea is shallow, so not for active swimming exercises, there are almost no waves.

Excellent promenade for a stroll, run, cycle, scooter trip. Tons of bus and taxi stands - as well as tiny and big refreshment centers. Mainly one of the few free public beach access areas with a decent crowd.

places.address: Al Bateen - W10 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Hudayriyat Island in Abu Dhabi is a haven for fitness enthusiasts, offering top-notch sports facilities like cycling tracks and tennis courts. It's also a burgeoning community with food trucks, a beachfront area, and an aqua pool for kids' birthdays. The island boasts serene surroundings with lush greenery and turquoise waters, making it perfect for leisurely walks and family outings.

sources.snippet: For many years, residents of Abu Dhabi often referred to the ‚Äòbridge to nowhere‚Äô ‚Äì now, that bridge finally leads to the spectacular beach hotspot of Al Hudayriyat Island. Access to the beach and sun lounges on Hudayriyat is free, and the open sea is a real draw. The water temperatures are a little cooler than the shallow waters of the Corniche, and the sand is soft underfoot, making this one of the best Abu Dhabi beaches for families.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi in 2024

sources.snippet: Leave the city and the main island and head to Al Hudayriyat Island to take your beach day out to the next level. From chomping on a tasty burger or sumptuous sandwiches from one of the food trucks decorating the length of the beach to making a night of it at Bab Al-Nojoum‚Äôs glamping site, this is one beach trip that will have you counting down the days to your return next weekend. For more information Hudayriyat Island
sources.shortName: 10 best public beaches in Abu Dhabi 2024

places.name: Hudayriyat Island

reviews.text: One of the beautiful, clean and well maintained beach in Abu Dhabi üåä, personally my favorite. Sandy beach, with walking / jogging track along with cycling track, makes the area more attractive for activities. Various cafes are also there to have snacks and drinks. Also various boating activities are there to rent a boat or jet ski etc. You should definitely visit and experience it for yourself..!

Well organized beach in abudhabi. I'm going every Sunday's. If you want a private it's charged around  50 dirham. Very clean and neat. Divers are always on duty. Now public free swimming area relocate to the left side of the entrance. You should take left in after bridge crossing roundabout. Very salty water please wear your goggles if you are come with kids.

Wonderful experience.

One of my friend suggested this place for an outing and his suggestion didn't disappoint. We went there to watch the sunset and truth to be told it wasn't that crowded even on a Sunday evening.

We spent around 2 hours there cafe hopping and watching the sunset. Ample space for parking and public transport buses are available from Abu Dhabi Central Bus Station.

Cafes are very cute and chic for celebrating birthdays and other events.

You can swim in the ocean also if you want to.
I heard that the night beach is paid.

places.address: C87X+9G2, Al Hudayriat Island, Al Hidayriyyat - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Saadiyat Beach Club is a luxurious beach club located on the Blue Flag-certified shores of the Arabian Gulf. It offers day passes for access to the beach, swimming pool, and gym. The club features live DJs, cabanas, and multiple swimming pools for relaxation. Guests can enjoy Mediterranean flavors at Safina restaurant or indulge in a fabulous pool and beachside Friday brunch with options like barbecue, seafood, and cheese.

sources.snippet: Lounge on a 9km stretch of Blue Flag-certified beach at Saadiyat Beach Club. Enjoy a swim and keep an eye out for dolphins or Hawksbill turtles, as the club is part of the protected habitat where these critically endangered creatures have nested for years. Dip in the outdoor chilled pool or grab a bite at one of the restaurants to end your beach day.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Saadiyat Beach Club - Luxury Beach Club in Abu Dhabi

reviews.text: Saadiyat Beach Club felt like a secret escape where the turquoise sea meets white sands in perfect harmony. I spent the day between the infinity pool and the calm of my cabana, with the sound of waves never too far away. The service was warm, the atmosphere effortlessly chic, and the views‚Ä¶ endless. Watching the sun melt into the horizon, I felt a deep stillness the kind that reminds you that sometimes, the most beautiful luxury is simply peace.

Unfortunately, my experience at Saadiyat Beach Club was disappointing. The staff did not seem motivated or welcoming, and their service lacked attentiveness and warmth. Additionally, the facilities and amenities were limited, and I felt that the overall experience did not justify the high price. For the amount charged, I expected a much higher level of service and hospitality. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and works on improving the customer experience.

We recently moved here from California and couldn't be happier to have found the perfect beach club to call our own. The pristine white sand, the temperature-controlled pool, and the warm hospitality make every visit special. The atmosphere is relaxed, and the sunsets are absolutely breathtaking.

This summer, I've been spending a lot of time in the gym, and I have to give a huge shout-out to my trainer, Ilcho, for keeping me motivated and on track. Meanwhile, my husband has been loving the men's salon. Truly, this club has something for both of us to enjoy! üåÖüí™‚ú®

places.address: Saadiyat Island, Exit 14, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Al Hudayriyat Island is a gem in Abu Dhabi, offering an array of activities that cater to both thrill-seekers and families alike. This expansive island features the stunning Al Hudayriyat Beach, which opened its doors in 2018 and stretches over 600 meters, providing a perfect spot for relaxation or fun under the sun. The island is packed with facilities such as tennis courts, football pitches, basketball courts, padel courts, and even a dedicated athletics track.

sources.snippet: This amazing new addition to Abu Dhabi was only opened to the public in July 2018 and is the new hotspot for beach and sport fanatics. Al Hudayriat Island is connected to the mainland city by a very impressive bridge and the entire island is only dedicated to sport and recreation. It features a 10km cycle track with bike rental, beachvolleyball, basketball, tennis and football courts, kayaking and kite surfing opportunities and plenty of foodtrucks.
sources.shortName: Beach in Abu Dhabi - The best Beaches across Abu Dhabi City

sources.snippet: This huge island opened its beach back in 2018 and is home to one of the best beaches in Abu Dhabi. The rest of the island remains untouched, the space just over the hulking Hudayriat Bridge is a popular spot. There are food trucks and sports facilities from the island and the 600 metre-long beach is open daily from 8am to 7pm and is free to use for the public.
sources.shortName: The 6 best beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Accessed by the mainland via a bridge, this manmade islet is home to a glorious 600-metre long beach that opened to the public in 2018. Still under the radar, Hudayriat Island‚Äôs beach is quieter than many others and offers unforgettable views of the Gulf. Thrill seekers will adore the Jet Ski, kayaking and kite surfing facilities.
sources.shortName: Abu Dhabis best beaches | Jumeirah

sources.snippet: Al Hudayriat Island is known to be among the best Abu Dhabi beaches that are surely the most enthralling attractions you have ever visited. This beach is located on a serene island where you can discover a unique thrill and beauty. Located far off the mainland, the beach is a secluded location where you can relax and rejuvenate.
sources.shortName: Top 12 Beaches In Abu Dhabi To Wash Away Your Troubles Of Everyday Life

sources.snippet: Another popular public beach in Abu Dhabi is Hudayriat Island Beach, a cozy spot under Hudayriat Bridge. If you‚Äôre strictly looking for some adventure in the waters, this particular beach is popular for such thrilling activities. This is surely among the awesome beaches to visit in Abu Dhabi!
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Al Hudayriat Island

reviews.text:
Al Hudayriat Island is indeed one of Abu Dhabi's standout recreational destinations. Compared to the Corniche Beach, it offers a unique island-style experience with a modern touch. It's a vibrant spot with plenty of activities for families, fitness enthusiasts, and adventure seekers.

Key Highlights:

‚úî Family-Friendly Attractions ‚Äì Multiple playgrounds, a kids' train, and water activities like boating make it perfect for families.
‚úî Food & Dining ‚Äì A variety of food trucks and restaurants provide diverse dining options.
‚úî Ample Parking & Rest Areas ‚Äì Well-planned infrastructure ensures convenience.
‚úî Outdoor Activities ‚Äì Cycling tracks, running trails, and water sports make it a fitness hub.
‚úî Future Potential ‚Äì With continuous development, it could become one of Abu Dhabi's top entertainment and leisure destinations.

If you love open spaces with modern facilities and a lively atmosphere, Al Hudayriat Island is definitely worth visiting!

Very beautiful very calm and clean beach in Abu dhabi.
All the beaches are good but this one is on next level.
No time limit, But you want to swim that you have to buy a ticket.
But for walk, evening or night coffee this one is good.

A must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy the sun, sea, and sand. Whether you're into water sports, beach volleyball, or just lounging with a good book, there's something for everyone!ü•∞ Whether you're a local or a traveler, this beach offers a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Highly recommend spending a day (or more!) soaking in its beautyüòçüëçüèªüëåü´∂

places.generalDescription: Al Bateen Beach, located in Abu Dhabi, is a picturesque and tranquil public beach offering stunning views of Hudariyat Island. With its fine sand and gentle waves, it's an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, fishing, and picnics. The beach provides amenities such as sun beds, umbrellas, and children's play areas. It's popular among locals and tourists alike for its ladies-only section and shallow waters suitable for families with young kids.

sources.snippet: Al Bateen Beach is one of the beautiful and calm public beaches situated in Abu Dhabi and offering the splendid view of Hudariyat Island. This beach is situated outside the main city central business district and is characterized by a fine grain sand and low energy beach waves making it suitable for relaxation and family events. Al Bateen Beach offers specific zones for swimming and offers all the necessary comforts like sun beds, umbrellas for picnicking, and children‚Äôs play areas to ensure that everyone will have a good time.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Public Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Al Bateen Beach public beach is a favourite among residents, locals and tourists alike ‚Äì thanks to impressive views of Al Hudayriat Island and a well-used ladies-only section. The shallow, calm waters also make the 800-metre stretch a good choice for families with young children. For fans of water sports, paddleboards, jet skis and snorkelling equipment can be hired on site, and a sunset kayak is a great way to round off a day here ‚Äì as is a stop at the artisan ice cream parlour.
sources.shortName: The 8 best beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Thanks to its sheltered location on Abu Dhabi‚Äôs western peninsula, Al Bateen Beach enjoys blissfully calm waters, which make it a family favourite with locals who love to swim and fish. Facing out onto Hudairiyat Island and with the cityscape in the distance, it‚Äôs a wonderfully scenic seaside spot that has been awarded Blue Flag status. A playground and ample watersports amenities also make Al Bateen one of Abu Dhabi‚Äôs most child-friendly beaches.
sources.shortName: Abu Dhabis best beaches | Jumeirah

sources.snippet: Al Bateen Beach is a free, public access beach so it gets quite popular with locals. It is one of the smaller beaches in Abu Dhabi but no less picturesque, and is a favourite viewing spot at sunset thanks to its views over Hudariyat Island and Hudariyat Bridge. The Blue Flag Beach is great for swimming and watersports and has a well maintained stretch of sand that has specific areas for playing volleyball or other sports.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Abu Dhabi Beach Guide.

sources.snippet: A family-friendly beach that looks out over to Al Hudayriyat Island and its bridge, Al Bateen Beach is a popular sandy location for both expats and locals. A holder of the prestigious Blue Flag sustainability award by the Emirates Wildlife Authority, the beach is fully equipped with shower and changing facilities, not to mention manicured lawns too. For more information check out Visit Abu Dhabi
sources.shortName: 10 best public beaches in Abu Dhabi 2024

sources.snippet: Al Bateen Beach is great for anybody wanting to do more than just lazing in completely clear waters. It takes you for fishing and watersports, for example, kayaking, rowing, and, surprisingly, jet skiing with jet skis available for hire. Inside the 800m of waterfront land, it likewise offers facilities for beach sports such as beach volleyball and some nice cafes.

sources.snippet: The Al Bateen Beach stretches over 800m overlooking the beautiful ocean and Hudairiyat Island. The beach is perfect for families and they can enjoy everything from fishing to swimming to a family picnic. Quiet-seekers will especially enjoy this location away from the bustle of the main city centre and corniche.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

It is renowned for its tranquil waters and serene atmosphere, making it an ideal place for relaxation and unwinding. The beach is open to the public and has many facilities, including bathing, changing rooms, and a range of water sports activities.

sources.snippet: A great beach for more reasons than its immaculately kept grounds and its lack of entry fee, Al Bateen Beach also offers great views of Hudariyat Island!. The area boasts swimmable waters, a full staff of lifeguards, family-friendly facilities, and great spots for picnicking. Don't forget your snorkeling gear!

sources.snippet: This Abu Dhabi beach covers 800m of picturesque waterfront in one of the city‚Äôs quieter areas and is Blue Flag certified. It overlooks Hudariyat Island and Hudariyat Bridge, so it offers unique views. Pack a picnic and pick a gazebo, sun lounger or day bed to settle in for the day.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Out of all the Abu Dhabi beaches, this beach provides the most peaceful and calm atmosphere. The gleaming coastline, stretched over 800 meters, looks over the Hodariyat Bridge and Island. The calm waters and picturesque views give it a family friendly vibe.
sources.shortName: Top 12 Beaches In Abu Dhabi To Wash Away Your Troubles Of Everyday Life

sources.snippet: The beach overlooks Al Hudayriat Island and Al Hudayriat Bridge. Here you will find picturesque views and clear water and due to its vicinity to the villas, the beach is mainly frequented by "Locals". Ideal for fishing, swimming and picnics on the beach.

sources.snippet: Al Bateen Beach offers stunning views of Hudariyat Island and Hudariyat Bridge. As a Blue Flag beach, it's popular for water sports and swimming. Facilities include changing rooms, showers, and a children‚Äôs playground.

reviews.text:
Clean and well-maintained beach!
I went for an early morning swim around 6 am and was impressed by how clean the beach was. All the facilities are there, including cool drinking water, and there are lifeguards on duty. A great spot for a refreshing swim!

Public beach in Abu Dhabi, try the reflexology pathway to relax and increase the blood circulation in your feet, its a nice and unique experience, the beach is very clean and nice, and we had an enjoyable experience.

places.generalDescription: Abu Dhabi Beach is a stunning destination that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and recreation. With its soft sandy shores, visitors can enjoy swimming, picnicking, and even playing volleyball in designated areas. For those staying away from the beach, there are plenty of options to experience the water‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs indulging in luxury at exclusive beach clubs like Saadiyat Beach or Yas Beach or opting for budget-friendly public beaches along the Corniche.

sources.snippet: Tourists hoping to get a respite from the heat of Dubai choose to travel along the Sheikh Zayed Road towards Abu Dhabi to access the private beach of Ghantoot. The area is one of the most popular local spots for holding beach parties, yet it remains less crowded ordinarily with only about a handful of people at the beachfront on weekdays. It has turned out to be an open secret of Emiratis and Expat population who are often found heading out of the city to this fantastic beach.

sources.snippet: Tourists who want to escape from the heat of Dubai choose to travel along the Sheikh Zayed Road towards Abu Dhabi to access the private beach of Ghantoot. sources.snippet: It is probably one of the few places on earth that will have such pristine, soft, white sanded beaches touching the soft light turquoise waters and lined with a metropolitan, high rise skyline. You have a choice between exclusive public beaches to private, more secluded ones. The public ones are also called exclusive because they are treated with such care that the difference may lie only in the number of visitors found.

places.name: Abu Dhabi Beach

reviews.text:
Abu Dhabi Beach, or more commonly known as the beaches of Abu Dhabi, offers some of the best coastal experiences in the UAE. The city boasts several pristine beaches, with some of the most popular being Corniche Beach, Saadiyat Beach, and the private beaches of luxury resorts like the Emirates Palace.

Corniche Beach is the most accessible public beach, with well-maintained facilities, plenty of space, and stunning views of the turquoise waters of the Arabian Gulf. It's perfect for a leisurely day out, with a long walking and cycling path along the coastline, sunbeds for rent, and shaded areas. The beach is clean, family-friendly, and has a great vibe for relaxing, though it can get crowded during weekends and holidays.

Saadiyat Beach, located on Saadiyat Island, is known for its natural beauty and quieter atmosphere. It has soft white sand and crystal-clear water, making it perfect for swimming and sunbathing. The beach is also home to some of the city's most luxurious resorts, but it is still accessible to the public. The surrounding nature, including mangroves and wildlife, adds to the serene vibe of Saadiyat Beach, though access might be limited to certain areas.

For those staying at luxury hotels or resorts like the St. Regis Saadiyat Island Resort, the Ritz-Carlton, or the Emirates Palace, you'll find private, exclusive beaches with impeccable service and stunning views. These spots provide great opportunities for water sports, beach clubs, and more.

While Abu Dhabi's beaches are undoubtedly beautiful, the water temperature can be quite

üåü **Abu Dhabi Beach Review** üåü

As a regular visitor to Abu Dhabi Beach, I can't recommend this place highly enough! Every time I go, I'm impressed by how super clean and well-maintained it is. The stunning turquoise water never fails to draw you in, and the lifeguards on duty add an extra layer of safety, making it a great spot for all ages.

One of the standout features is the special access for wheelchairs, which is fantastic for ensuring that everyone can enjoy the beautiful beach. The showers and free drinking water stations are also a big plus, making it easy to rinse off and stay refreshed after a day in the sun.

I absolutely love that you can bring your own food and drinks, which makes it perfect for a relaxing picnic by the water. There's also plenty of space to play sports-whether it's volleyball, frisbee, or any other fun outdoor activity, you'll find the perfect spot.

Overall, Abu Dhabi Beach is a delightful destination that combines cleanliness, accessibility, and recreational opportunities. I always look forward to my visits, and I can't wait to go back! üåäüèñÔ∏è‚ú®

Swimming in the evening offers a serene and spiritual experience like no other. The water glistens under the soft glow of the setting sun, creating a captivating ambience. I strongly encourage you to carve out time at least once a week to immerse yourself in this tranquil setting. In addition to swimming, you'll discover a selection of boats and kayaks available at reasonable prices, perfect for exploring the peaceful waters. Take the opportunity to connect with nature and unwind!

places.address: Al Hisn - W1 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Al Bateen, Abu Dhabi, The Bayshore Beach Club is a hidden gem offering a relaxed atmosphere within the InterContinental Abu Dhabi. Boasting a 300m sandy beach and an infinity pool with a swim-up bar, it's an all-rounder beach club. The club features children's pools, jacuzzis, and spas set amidst lush gardens. For the active visitor, there are tennis courts, squash facilities, and a fully equipped gym.

sources.snippet: Bayshore Beach is a hidden gem located in the InterContinental Abu Dhabi that is much loved by the locals. It affords breathtaking view of the marina and gives an environment that is quite conducive for relaxation. Accommodation includes beautiful gardens, a large swimming pool, and several restaurants so it offers a beautiful atmosphere for a delightful day at the beach.

sources.snippet: For sports enthusiasts, the Beach Rotana beach club offers water sports, squash courts and tennis courts, among others. Bayut also recommends checking out the Fairmont Bab Al Bahr‚Äôs Beach Club that offers kayaking, paddleboarding, and other beach sports.

Sejin and the rest of the team have looked after use while we have been at the pool. Service food and drinks really nice in a lovely location. We will be back.
Great outdoor pool grassy area. Lots of shade. Lovely pools and a slide for kids. Beach area.

places.generalDescription: Yas Island is a small island located just 20 kilometers east of Abu Dhabi city center. It is known for its Grand Prix car-racing circuit, amusement parks, a beach, and a golf course. The island offers unlimited access to theme parks, shopping malls, sports arenas, trendy restaurants, and luxurious residential properties. Yas Marina Circuit is one of the main attractions on the island and hosts various motorsport competitions and events.

sources.snippet: There are all kinds of beaches in Abu Dhabi, each with its public: the most well known are those of The corniche - the most beautiful are on Saadiyat Island - the smallest on Yas Island, along the mangrove - the most confidential at the the Emirates Palace. places.name: Yas Island

reviews.text: Probably the the best of what Abu Dhabi has to offer, everything under one roof from Ferrari world to sea world to the yas marina circuit and tons of shopping options

My experience with Yas Island was wonderful, thank God.
I booked the hotel through their website, and the reservation includes tickets, entry, and play for all the parks. We visited SeaWorld, Warner Bros., the water parks, and Ferrari World.
Guys, I'm tired of telling you that all the employees are respectful.
The place is very clean.
The service is excellent

nice place for waking and drinks. The ambiance is inviting, with cozy seating and soft lighting that makes it perfect for both casual meet-ups and intimate gatherings. The menu features a variety of refreshing beverages, from artisanal coffees to vibrant smoothies, catering to all tastes. As you stroll around, you can enjoy the greenery and perhaps even catch a glimpse of local art displayed on the walls. It's a spot where friends can relax and unwind, making it an ideal destination for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life. The soothing background music adds to the overall charm, creating an atmosphere that encourages conversation and connection. Whether you're starting your day with a cup of coffee or winding down with a drink in the evening, this place is sure to leave a lasting impression.

places.generalDescription: Soul Beach is a beautiful and pristine beach located on Saadiyat Island in Abu Dhabi. Its white sand, crystal-clear waters, and idyllic views of the Arabian Gulf are sure to please visitors. The beach features a large pavillion that can be used for sunbathing, swimming, or simply enjoying a day at the beach. There are also several restaurants and loungers available for use, making Soul Beach an ideal place to relax and enjoy the sunset.
places.name: Mamsha Beach

reviews.text: absolutely amazing place, serene, beautiful and most important clean. this beach has it all. crystal clear water, white sand, soft gentle waves. they have life guards as well who are so attentive and helpful. you do pay to enter, however your payment gets you a beach bed and towels and water. the facilities to wash up are also clean and work well.

We love this beach and for three years in a row we have always gone here and looked forward to this beach the most out of all the beaches in the UAE. This year we were disappointed with the price of entry and parking, which has increased significantly. They changed the sunbeds and you get water and towels at the entrance. If you go here it is really a beautiful place but I have to remove stars from the rating because of the price - I don't like it. And if I pay for entry to the beach I would like to at least have free parking.

A new beach, beautiful views. It is a paid beach. Still you can go and have a leisure walk on the pavement right by the beach. Feels very peaceful due to limited crowd. Nearby areas are upscale places, something can be explored basis individual interests.

places.address: Mamsha, Al Saadiyat Island - SDN1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Nurai Island, also known as Zaya Nurai Island, is a luxurious private island resort located just a short boat ride away from Abu Dhabi's Saadiyat Island. The resort offers spacious sea-facing villas with private terraces and temperature-controlled rim-flow pools, providing stunning views of the private beach. The accommodations range from one-bedroom beachfront villas to five and six-bedroom beachfront estate villas.

sources.snippet: For barefoot luxury, head to Nurai Island, a boutique private island resort ‚àí just a 12-minute boat ride from Abu Dhabi's Saadiyat Island. Complete with luxurious villas, plunge pools, sea swings and spas, everything here is designed to ease stress. Try sunset yoga or let the wind lull you to a relaxing nap on a hammock or day bed.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Nurai Island

reviews.text: I just got back from Nurai Island Resort and I'm impressed. The variety of food was really good, and the service didn't disappoint. The resort has a lively feel, thanks to its colorful decor and chic furniture. It's a bit on the expensive side, but the cleanliness and well-organized setting justify the cost. Definitely a good pick for a luxury escape.

As a mother coming to this hotel was something I looked forward to for a long time. We booked a one bedroom bungalow with promising  privacy and a swimming pool. Just before 7AM we were woken up by a terribly loud drilling sound. It was so loud that I practically jumped out of bed. Needless to say, sleeping in and relaxation was gone out of the window. We called the reception and they promised to stop. It didn't stop and continued endless to the point that around 10AM we gathered our belongings and left the room. Outside,  staring at our ‚Äúprivate‚Äù pool were several workers on the roof so enjoying the pool or the beach  was out of question. The hotel manager offered us a free lunch which we respectfully declined because we came to relax and to sleep in not to have a mediocre free meal at over AED 3800 per night.  I simply asked for another stay when the construction was over and we could get exactly what we paid for. I wasn't interested in anything free- what I expected  was for the management to simply refund us the money for the stay they couldn't provide, move us to another villa away from the noise or offer a complimentary stay in the future to make up for a ruined holiday. None of these options were offered, none of our emails were answered and at this point we have decided to take this further. Yes, construction is something that will end eventually and this post may feel irrelevant. However, this is not about construction- this post is about terrible customer service when a client who paid in full and paid premium is placed into a situation where no resolution is offered and  any discomfort is not something the hotel is willing to take responsibility for. Inna situation where room is paid at check out - I would have never paid but because prepayment is required the hotel has nothing to lose.  This is not luxury - this is ignorance and if you are looking to spend your hard earned money - I would look at other options where your business is valued, appreciated  and where from the moment you step inside the hotel and up until  you leave - everything is catered to ensure you have a pleasant stay. Very disappointing and frustrating at the same time.

UPDATE: After about three weeks and a couple of email exchanges our stay was refunded. We hope to come back for a different experience.

I had a terrible experience at this hotel. Firstly, the cleanliness was appalling; we discovered tiny bugs all over the bathroom floors. Additionally, the buggy service was consistently late. The worst part was when they cut off the water supply for the entire night, a shocking 10-hour ordeal, and didn't bother to inform us until it was too late. The overall value for the money I paid was abysmal. The food was dry and tasteless, and the service was simply terrible. I would strongly advise against staying here.

places.address: Nourai Island - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Nurai Island is an exclusive island destination in the UAE, accessible by a short-speed boat ride from the capital. The island boasts white-sand beaches and cerulean seas, reminiscent of the Maldives. It is home to a super exclusive luxury resort with private villas, but day passes are available for those who want to enjoy the beach and pool without staying overnight. places.name: Nurai Island

reviews.text:
Nurai Island Resort is situated along the Arabian Gulf in Abu Dhabi. Just a 12-minute boat ride from Abu Dhabi's Saadiyat Island and a 60-minute journey from Downtown Dubai. This exclusive island resort is surrounded by clear waters, powder-white soft sand and lush vegetation.

The contemporary villas are designed to blend into the landscape and they all come with private temperature-controlled pool and floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Arabian Sea. They boast an outdoor terrace, a spacious living area and Nespresso machine. A soothing soaking tub and rain shower are also featured.

Individual and group personal trainer and yoga sessions can be organised on sunrises and sunsets while the younger guests are having fun at the Petit Z kids club. Guests can experience the unique UAE ambiance of our exclusive Nurai Spa while enjoying magical view to the sea and listening to the waves during the individual spa session or rejuvenating couple massage.

Frangipani offers organic and seasonal produce sourced from local farms for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A pool setting like no other, Ginger Mermaid is a place with a fine selection of flawless morsels of raw sashimi and sushi carved by the experted chef.

Nurai Welcome Center is 10 minutes' drive away from Yas Mall and 13 minutes from Yas Links Golf course. This resort is only 30 minutes' journey from Abu Dhabi International Airport.

Nurai Island felt like slipping away into a private world where the sea and sky blend into endless blue. The soft sand, warm breeze, and gentle sound of waves made time slow down until it was just me, the sun, and the moment. Walking along the shore, I felt a deep calm - as if the island was quietly reminding me that peace isn't something you chase, it's something you allow.

I had a SPA treatment with Victoria which was amazing!! She got magical hands üòç. I also went for food at DUSK, and I got very welcomed by the lovely staff and the food was great. Everyone around the island is helpful.
Excellent day, please keep up the quality of the servicesüëåüèΩ

places.address: Nourai Island - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Yas Beach is a luxurious club located on Yas Island, Abu Dhabi. It offers a range of activities such as water sports, beach volleyball, and an outdoor fitness center. The beach features a large pool, a smaller splash area, and clean sandy shores for relaxation.

Yas Beach offers a large pool, a smaller splash area, and a pristinely clean sandy beach.

sources.shortName: Choosing the Best Beach in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: You might be on the lookout for a twist to your beach experience and Yas Beach could just be right up your alley. Proudly poised on the shores of the famous Yas Island, Yas Beach Club in Abu Dhabi is fittingly known for delicious brunches and awesome music.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Yas Beach

reviews.text: This beach club truly has it all - from the moment you arrive, you're immersed in a vibrant atmosphere where the sea, music, and great food come together perfectly. The views of the ocean and surrounding marine life make it feel like a hidden paradise. The live music added the perfect vibe, and the food and drinks were top-notch - fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Whether you're there to relax, dance, or enjoy gourmet bites by the water, this place hits every mark. Can't wait to return!

We went to this beach club recently and the vibe is amazing. The dj show and the people there were so energetic and engaging. The service of the staff were 10/10. They were very attentive and friendly. The food was so good as well. Overall I had an amazing experience and I meet a lot of great people there. I am really looking forward to visit this place again soon. Thank you so much Yas beach club for the best hospitality and experience.

It has a calm and high-quality atmosphere. Sunbathing with a view of Ferrari World is such a pleasure. I love their burgers, and of course, their iced coffee too. we went more then 10 times and all excellent :)

places.address: 92 Al Ihtiraf St, Yas Island - YS3 06 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: The Emirates Palace Beach Club Mandarin Wing in Abu Dhabi is an exclusive and luxurious venue offering a unique experience. With a stunning 1.3km long beachfront, two resort pools, fitness centers, tennis and padel courts, and a water sports center, it's the perfect destination for those seeking relaxation or adventure. Guests can enjoy exquisite dining at the full-service restaurant or unwind on the shore while taking in the cool ocean breeze.

sources.snippet: Emirates Palace Beach is a section of the famous Emirates Palace Hotel and gives a taste of luxury on the coastline of Abu Dhabi. Although most of the beach is owned by private individuals, a part of it is open to the public and tourists can enjoy the white sand and clear blue water of the beach. The beach has very good amenities and the environment is very quiet and calm making it a perfect place for the lovers of luxury.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Must-Visit Public Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Emirates Palace Beach is a private beach located at the Emirates Palace Hotel. The beach is renowned for its luxurious amenities, including private cabanas, water sports activities, and food and drink outlets. Moreover, Emirates Palace Beach is also home to many upscale villas and apartments, making it a famous destination for those seeking a luxurious retreat.
sources.shortName: Guide To Abu Dhabi Beaches: Locations, Photos, And Ratings.

sources.snippet: This 1.3 km of pristine beach overlooking the Arabian Gulf is the natural bay that acts as the private beach to the luxurious Emirates Palace Hotel. The beach is crystalline white, with shallow azure waves kissing the shore. The beach is perfect for a secluded getaway, easily feeling as if it were your own.
sources.shortName: 10 paradise beaches in Abu Dhabi you need to visit!

sources.snippet: This pristine beach overlooking the Arabian Gulf is in the natural bay that acts as the private beach to the luxurious Emirates Palace Hotel. The beach has fine white sand, with shallow azure waves touching the shore. The beach is ideal for an ideal getaway, easily feeling as if it were your own.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Beaches in Abu Dhabi for a Peaceful Getaway

places.name: Emirates Palace Beach Club Mandarin Wing

reviews.text: ‚ÄúThe best place to spend your day with excellent and wonderful service, and the staff are amazing. A big thank you to Chaymae from Beach Club and Yosri Kids Palace for arranging my husband's birthday in the most beautiful way possible.‚Äù ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite having lived in Abu Dhabi for 4 years this was our first visit to the Beach Club at Emirates Palace. We normally use the Saadiyat hotels and beach clubs. However, I can genuinely say we had a an excellent time. The space and facilities are first class, and the service was excellent. Lindah did an excellent job of looking after all our needs, and the food was tasty, high quality and fairly priced. We will definitely be back!

Excellent for kids.
Pool opens at 07H00.
Slides open at 09H00.
Pools close ar 19H00 for kids.

places.address: Al Ras Al Akhdar - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

sources.snippet: Al Sahil Beach in Abu Dhabi is a beautiful seashore with loads of facilities to make a day at the beach exciting. Visitors need to pay a small entry fee to access this beach. Some beach ethics are expected from visitors; otherwise, there are no restrictions upon entering and exploring Al Sahil Beach.
sources.shortName: 10 Beaches in Abu Dhabi for a Perfect Beachside Vacation 2024

sources.snippet: Al Shahil beach in Abu Dhabi is a peaceful and serene place to spend a day with family and friends. It is a gorgeous seashore with lots to do, which makes it an exciting day. The view from this family beach in Abu Dhabi is breathtaking with a blend of tall buildings and deep sea.
sources.shortName: Top 12 Beaches In Abu Dhabi To Wash Away Your Troubles Of Everyday Life

places.name: CORNICHE PAID SAHIL BEACH

reviews.text: Perfect, large, and quiet public beach. For a 10 AED entrance fee, you have a lifeguard, gated space, changing room, and shower. For 30 AED, a mat and umbrella... a good bet.

Nice beach, almost at the middle of the Corniche. Paid 10 dirham to enter and about 26 dirham for the mat and sunbed. There were not so many people on the beach, it was clean and affordable, the water wasn.t that deep and it.s colour was just great. And the view was perfect

It is Relaxing and quiet here. There is an entrance fee and table and chair you can rent so you can put your things and food. You have to go here early atleast before 10am so its not super hot or you will have sun burn.

places.address: 635 ÿ¥ÿßÿ±ÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÑŸÉ ÿπÿ®ÿØÿßŸÑŸÑŸá ÿ®ŸÜ ÿπÿ®ÿØÿßŸÑÿπÿ≤Ÿäÿ≤ ÿ¢ŸÑ ÿ≥ÿπŸàÿØ, Al Bateen - W10 01 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Kai Beach Saadiyat is a secluded 500m stretch of pristine white sand, offering shaded sun loungers and a laid-back restaurant with a bar. It's an ideal destination for families or groups with diverse interests. Visitors can relax on the beach, take part in water sports, and enjoy thrilling aquatic activities. The beach's bistro provides a refreshing escape from the sun, allowing guests to savor their favorite cocktails before returning to the beach for more fun.

sources.snippet: Previously the Saadiyat Public Beach, and now managed by Saadiyat Beach Club, this piece of turquoise heaven has sun loungers, changing rooms and showers you can use. Enjoy a little 'sun-lounger service' with drinks served right to you and replenish your energy from the nearby food truck. The day pass for adults is AED 125 on weekdays and AED 200 on weekends.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Saadiyat Beach is the most popular beach in Abu Dhabi, it is definitely the most beautiful beach in the area, perhaps in the entire Emirates. Abu Dhabi residents and tourists alike love this amazing, once only accessible by boat, beach. The sand is dazzling white and the water in contrast turquoise blue and on calm days, the water is crystal clear.
sources.shortName: Beach in Abu Dhabi - The best Beaches across Abu Dhabi City
Abu Dhabi Beaches - 11 Best Beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: The Saadiyat Public Beach, covering about 400 metres, is set on the Saadiyat Island‚Äôs natural shores. The beach is managed by the beach operator, BAKE and was opened in 2013. Here, beachgoers can enjoy a relaxed day outdoors with the white sandy shores and tranquil blue waves, as well as a multitude of water sports and activities.
sources.shortName: 10 Beaches in Abu Dhabi for a Perfect Beachside Vacation 2024

sources.snippet: Saadiyat Public Beach is one of Abu Dhabi's most stunning public beaches. It easily rivals private beach clubs with its breathtaking surroundings. Located along the northern shore of Saadiyat Island, the entrance is just east of the Park Hyatt Abu Dhabi Hotel and Villas.
sources.shortName: Best beaches in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for the best beaches in Abu Dhabi that have a fresh take, Kai Beach Saadiyat opened just two years ago. It‚Äôs located where Saadiyat Public Beach used to be and is now managed by Saadiyat Beach Club. The beach is open daily from 7am to sunset.
sources.shortName: The 6 best beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Kai Beach Saadiyat

reviews.text: Very beautiful place, we paid 125 AED each on a Friday, we had included a big bed with sun umbrella and a voucher of 50 AED each that you can use for drinks and food there. It was a good deal for us. We really enjoyed the food. The beach is wonderful, with clear water, lots of small cute fish, and plenty of space to walk or run by the beach.

Overall, the place is nice and has a relaxing beach vibe, especially during the summer üåûüåä
But I think it could use a bit more development to make the experience even better:
‚Ä¢	They should offer a wider variety of juices and drinks, especially in the hot weather - something refreshing and fun would really add to the beach atmosphere üçπüçç
‚Ä¢	Also, the number of showers is limited. On the ladies-only day, it gets pretty crowded, and there aren't enough showers for everyone üöø

In general, I had a good time, and the place has a lot of potential. With a few improvements, it could be even more enjoyable ‚ú®
Looking forward to seeing it grow!
With the purchase of a day pass, you can access the beach - sunbeds and an umbrella are included. Enjoy a pleasant time at the restaurant with a stunning sunset view.

places.address: GCWP+R74, Al Saadiyat Island - SDN1 - Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

places.generalDescription: Al Lulu Island, located off the coast of Abu Dhabi, is a serene and artificial island offering stunning views of the city's skyline and the Corniche. The palm-backed beach is known for its mesmerizing blue sea and vibrant atmosphere. Visitors can explore St. Joseph Catholic Church or take a tour of Sheikh Zayed Cricket Stadium. The island also features several malls for shopping enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Accessible only by private boat, Lulu Island offers a unique adventure off the coast of Abu Dhabi. With sand dunes and untouched beaches, it‚Äôs the perfect place for jet skiing, swimming, and sunbathing. After a day of adventure, pack a picnic and enjoy delicious food while soaking in the serene surroundings.
sources.shortName: Life's a beach: 11 of the best public beaches in Abu Dhabi

places.name: Al Lulu Island

reviews.text: It was good experience on lulu island. Light show will end by Jan 31. If any one wants to see must book ticket online adult aed 25 children below 12 aed10.

Great place to be alone with your family or friends...

You can book a ride to Lulu Island from Marina Yacht club , so many companies provide ride from there to Lulu island , just visit them or call and book a ride in advance..
Contact numbers are displayed in front of Yacht club Marina entrance.
Can bok a small boat for group of 10 - 12 person boat for 250 AED.

For small family smaller boat is available..

Hardly 10 min drive in boat from there...

You can chose either sea side or city side..
Captain will drop accordingly..

Nice broad beach area for camping, be mind full about high tide

ACCORDING TO THE SIGN BOARD ON THE BEACH OVER NIGHT CAMPING IS NOT ALLOWED

But we hd a nice over night camping experience there..

We chose place on sea side.

We chose are with trees..
Careful about the water pipes for tree , not to damage that.

We had the entire Island for us as it was week day..

Boat will drop us there and leave and will pick up in the morning at the time we request.
Keep captain number in case of emergency , so you can call and they will pick up if needed.

Birds , cats and some FOXES are there.( Which we noticed in the morning) , but only cats will be around during night.

Take all gadgets including portable toilet as no facilities are there..

Be responsible for you waste, which you can carry back to the yacht club and dumb there...

No entry fee..

You can have sea bath , but its not shallow water , no waves as wave barrier is available..

Even in sea side you can enjoy bit of city view..

Dont recommend to explore the island in night as I mentioned foxes are there.

Early morning is the best time for that..

Will get a nice sun set in sea and great sunrise from city side..

Fishing also possible, if you camp near to the ferry, it easy for moving things to camp site as you have to Carry all items yourself, advised to have a trolley..

In yacht club they have trolley to move thins from car to boat

No shops or any kind of facilities..

1 ‚≠ê drop due to no facilities

Beautiful light show. With lots of scientific knowledge.
This is located close to the flag pole corniche. Parking could be available near Marina Mall. It is better to be early , 4 stands for ticket counters available.  But the crowd is massive. There are interesting artworks to see on the island
There are food trucks , restrooms, and prayer  areas  inside, along with benches, to relax
Not stroller & Wheelchair friendly.
The walk is in sand hence Comfortable shoes are important.
It's about being patience as the queue gets long while waiting for the boat, but it's worth seeing .
